schedule.description: Tea, coffee and pastries on arrival.
Welcome from Derek Shanks and an overview of the agenda. This will be followed by various sessions in St Giles, details of which can be found on the 'Agenda' tab.
There will be a 15 minute break for you to grab a tea or a coffee.
The talk schedule continues, again on the same tables and in St Giles.
Lunch is served in Canongate with time for networking.
Head to St Giles where you will be taken to the expo held in Dunedin.
Quick break between expo sessions, with tea and coffee provided in Dunedin.
Meet back in Dunedin for the expo, following which we will finish back in St Giles room for the final talks and closing remarks.
Once the event is over, drinks and canapes will be provided in the Canongate room.

expos.name: Adviser Reviser
expos.description: The adviser lab will give you a refresher of the adviser market, a run down of their systems and their plans for future delivery

expos.name: Personalisation A/B Testing
expos.description: A/B Testing empowers fast, confident decisions backed by data optimising headlines, layouts and journeys helps us understand what truly matters.

expos.name: Accessibility
expos.description: We‚Äôll outline our approach to accessibility testing‚Äîfocusing on how we ensure that every digital experience we deliver is both functional and inclusive. This involves rigorous validation across a range of user scenarios, devices, and assistive technologies to confirm that our solutions meet accessibility standards and provide equitable access for all users.

expos.name: Gamifying User Experiences
expos.description: See how we are using games and gamified experiences to boost customer engagement and education. With live demos on new tools to the group like Unity and Rive as well as a hands on demo with our first gamified education experience brought to the Scottish Widows app.

expos.name: Connect Microservice
expos.description: Connect is a no-code/low-code orchestration platform that lets users build automated workflows‚Äîcalled Flows‚Äîusing modular Blocks like Send SMS‚Äù or ‚ÄúQuery Data.‚Äù It supports both synchronous and asynchronous actions and integrates easily with existing APIs. Trigger Options: Scheduled, ad hoc, and (soon) event-driven Tech Stack: NodeJS, Docker, Kubernetes, GCP Use Case: Notify customers of retirement payment progress via SMS using Pega and DCM3. Connect accelerates delivery by reusing existing business logic, improves developer experience through shared utilities, and is backed by strong documentation and cross-team collaboration.

expos.name: Content Square
expos.description: An introduction to ContentSquare, a new and creepy tool introduced to IP&I to help us better understand our customers usage of our digital estate.

expos.name: Interstellar
expos.description: In this session, the Interstellar team will explore how component-based architecture empowers engineers to build scalable, brand-consistent web journeys across multiple platforms‚Äîincluding Embark, Waterfront, and Enterprise environments.

expos.name: Predictive Engagement
expos.description: In this session, we‚Äôll demonstrate how Genesys leverages AI-driven predictive engagement to optimise the customer journey for solar panel sales. By analysing user behaviour on the website, Genesys can assess the likelihood of a customer not completing a desired outcome‚Äîsuch as making a purchase‚Äîand proactively tailor support strategies.

talks.topic: Welcome and the Game Plan ahead!

speakers: Professor Simon Gay, University of Glasgow

talks.topic: Transition back to St Giles from Expo
Results of People Adventure and IVR Game

jammers.welcomeDescription: Here are some details about what you will be doing at the game jam. We can't wait to see what you create!
jammers.challengeDescription: Create a game or gamified journey to help close the gender gap in pensions and investments.
jammers.judgingDescription: Our judges will be considering the following when casting their vote:

criteria.title: Fun & Engaging
criteria.description: We want to prioritise a fun, player-first experience when creating games. Does it convey the core idea well? Does it stand out? Would you play it again and again?

criteria.title: Approachability & Accessibility
criteria.description: Is your game easy to pick up and play? Can anyone play it? Have you taken into consideration different people's needs?

criteria.title: Theme Interpretation & Creativity
criteria.description: There is a challenge to solve, but it's up to you and your team on how you approach it. Does your game fit with the theme? Is your concept unique?

criteria.title: Feasibility & Viability
criteria.description: As we will take the winning idea forward, it's important for us to consider how realistic the solution is. Could this be built, supported and scaled within LBG? Does your game consider existing LBG technlogies, platforms and hosting capabilities?

criteria.title: Technical Execution & Polish
criteria.description: While the focus is on the process, we still want to showcase technical excellence. Does your game run smoothly? Are there any bugs? Have you solved a tricky technical problem?

judgingCriteria.criteriaDescription: If you would like a more detailed breakdown of the judging criteria, you can download it below.

Pitches.title: Pitches
Pitches.description: On day two, all teams will pitch their game to their assigned coaches. Coaches will then shortlist teams to present to our judging panel.
Pitches.length: Each pitch should be 8 minutes, with an additional 2 minutes for questions.
Pitches.presentation: You can use slides, a live demo, or any other format you like to present your game. Be creative and have fun!
Pitches.coachTime: Pitches to the coaches will begin at 12:30pm
Pitches.judgeTime: Pitches to the judges will begin at 2:00pm

Awards.description: The winning teams will be announced at the end of day two, with prizes as follows:

prizes.all:
You will be invited to LBG to bring your idea to life in the Scottish Widows App.

 Each team member will receive 1-2-1 mentorship from a Women ConnecTech mentor.

 Plus tickets to our Reboot conference in November.
Your team will receive career workshops and tickets to our Reboot conference in November.
Your team will receive career workshops
